Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I’ve been okay. I actually started doing a few minutes of yoga like we talked about.
That’s fantastic! How did it feel to get back into it?
It was nice. I felt a bit more relaxed afterward, but I still struggled with motivation on some days.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI):Current Functional Status

Utterance: It’s great that you made the effort! It’s normal to have ups and downs with motivation. What do you think might help on those tougher days?
Maybe setting a specific time each day for it? Like making it part of my routine.
That’s a solid idea! Routines can help create consistency. Have you thought about what time might work best for you?
I think in the morning might be good. I usually feel a bit more energized then.
Morning yoga sounds like a wonderful plan! Let’s set that as a goal for the next week. How does that sound?
Sounds good! I’ll give it a shot.
Great! I’m looking forward to hearing how it goes. You mentioned last time about exploring volunteer opportunities. Have you had a chance to look into that?
I did! I found a few places that work with kids, and I’m thinking of reaching out to them.
That’s excellent progress! What’s holding you back from reaching out?
I guess I’m a little nervous about it. What if they don’t want me or if I don’t fit in?
It’s completely normal to feel nervous about new experiences. Remember, you’re bringing valuable skills and a willingness to help. Would it help to think about what you can offer them?
Yeah, I suppose I could focus on that instead of my fears.
Absolutely! Shifting your focus can help ease some of that anxiety. What do you think you can contribute to the organization?
I think I can bring a lot of patience and creativity. I used to love planning activities for kids.
Those are wonderful qualities! It sounds like you have a lot to offer. Would you like to set a goal to reach out to one organization this week?
Yes, that sounds doable. I’ll try to do it by the end of the week.
Perfect! I’m excited for you. Now, how have you been feeling overall? Any changes in your mood or thoughts?
I think I’m feeling a little more hopeful lately, but I still have those days where I feel really low.

It’s encouraging to hear that you’re feeling more hopeful. It’s also okay to have low days; they’re part of the process. Have you noticed anything in particular that helps lift your mood on those tougher days?
I’ve been trying to connect with some old friends. Talking to them helps remind me that I’m not alone.
That’s a great strategy! Maintaining connections can provide support and comfort. How has reconnecting with them felt?
It’s been nice. A couple of them even want to meet up soon, which I’m looking forward to.
That sounds wonderful! Making plans with friends can be a great motivator. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I guess I just want to keep working on feeling better. I want to find that sense of purpose again.
That’s a meaningful goal. Remember, it’s a journey, and you’re taking steps in the right direction. We can continue to explore ways to help you find that purpose.
Thank you. I appreciate the support.
Of course! I’m here to help you through this process. Let’s check in next week about your yoga routine and your volunteering outreach. Sound good?
Yes, I’m looking forward to it!
Great! Take care of yourself, and I’ll see you soon.
Bye!
